payload.name: scientific
payload.core: Hypothetico-deductive cycle: abduce hypotheses from observations, deduce testable predictions, run experiments with statistical rigor, revise beliefs/theories based on evidence.

out.done: at least one prediction can be tested with available resources

out.s: if hypothesis true, then observable outcome X under conditions Y
out.done: prediction is specific enough to fail

out.s: protocol, controls, sample size, statistical test
out.done: power analysis shows test can detect expected effect

out.s: data, statistical analysis, confidence intervals, p-values
out.done: analysis pre-registered or exploratory clearly labeled
update magnitude justified by evidence strength

proc: Observe phenomenon: gather initial data, note patterns or anomalies
Abduce hypotheses: generate candidate explanations that would account for observations
Deduce predictions: derive specific, falsifiable predictions from each hypothesis
Design experiment: choose controls, sample size, statistical test; pre-register if possible
Run experiment: collect data according to protocol, document deviations
Analyze results: apply pre-specified statistical tests, compute effect sizes and intervals
Revise beliefs: update credences proportional to evidence strength, modify or reject hypotheses
Iterate: new observations prompt new hypotheses; refined predictions enable sharper tests
check: Hypotheses are falsifiable with specified observations
Predictions derive logically from hypothesis (not just correlated)
Experiment has adequate power to detect expected effect
Analysis plan specified before data collection or exploratory analysis flagged
Confidence intervals and effect sizes reported alongside p-values
Belief update proportional to evidence strength

diff.abductive: full cycle integrating generation, prediction, testing, revision vs hypothesis generation only
diff.statistical-frequentist: embeds statistical testing within broader inquiry loop vs testing alone
diff.bayesian-probabilistic: uses Bayesian update as one component vs pure belief update calculus
diff.experimental-design: includes hypothesis and revision phases vs experiment structure only
diff.engineering-design: goal is validated theory vs goal is working artifact

fail.mode: confirmation bias, underpowered experiments, publication bias
signals: only evidence supporting hypothesis is sought
sample size chosen for convenience, not power

mitigations.test: sample size justified by effect size and power target
at least one prediction designed to falsify hypothesis

rel.how: hypothesis generation step is abductive inference
belief revision can use Bayesian updating
experiments aim to establish causal claims

confusion.clarify: abduction generates hypotheses; scientific method also tests and revises them
experimental design structures tests; scientific method embeds design in full inquiry cycle
